item.text: Paul looked directly at the council and said, “Brothers, I have lived my life with a clear conscience before God to this day.”

<st data-num="1161">At that</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="749">high priest</st> <st data-num="367" class="">Ananias</st> <st data-num="2004" class="">ordered</st> those <st data-num="3936">standing near</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="846" class="">Paul</st><n id="3" /> to <st data-num="5180" class="">strike</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> on the <st data-num="4750" class="">mouth</st>.

<st data-num="5119" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="3004">said</st> <st data-num="4314">to</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, “<st data-num="2316">God</st> is <st data-num="3195" class="">going</st> to <st data-num="5180" class="">strike</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>, you <st data-num="2867" class="">whitewashed</st> <st data-num="5109" class="">wall</st>!<n id="1" /> Do<n id="2" /> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="2521" class="">sit</st> there <st data-num="2919" class="">judging</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st> <st data-num="2596" class="">according to</st> the <st data-num="3891" class="">law</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3891">in violation of the law</st><n id="4" /> you <st data-num="2753" class="">order</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st> to be <st data-num="5180" class="">struck</st>?”

Those <st data-num="3936">standing near</st> him<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>, “Do you dare <st data-num="3058" class="">insult</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2316" class="">God’s</st> <st data-num="749">high priest</st>?”
Paul replied, “I did not realize, brothers, that he was the high priest, for it is written, ‘You must not speak evil about a ruler of your people.’”

Then when Paul noticed that part of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees, he shouted out in the council, “Brothers, I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees. I am on trial concerning the hope of the resurrection of the dead!”

When <st data-num="846">he</st> <st data-num="3004">said</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st>,<n id="1" /> an <st data-num="4714" class="">argument</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1096" class="">began</st><n id="3" /> between the <st data-num="5330" class="">Pharisees</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4523" class="">Sadducees</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4128" class="">assembly</st> was <st data-num="4977" class="">divided</st>.

(<st data-num="1063">For</st> the <st data-num="4523" class="">Sadducees</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">say</st> there <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3361" class="">no</st> <st data-num="386" class="">resurrection</st>, <st data-num="3383" class="">or</st> <st data-num="32" class="">angel</st>, <st data-num="3383" class="">or</st> <st data-num="4151" class="">spirit</st>, <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> the <st data-num="5330" class="">Pharisees</st> <st data-num="3670" class="">acknowledge</st> <st data-num="297">them all</st>.)<n id="1" />

There <st data-num="1096" class="">was</st> a <st data-num="3173" class="">great</st> <st data-num="2906" class="">commotion</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">some</st> <st data-num="1122">experts in the law</st><n id="2" /> from the <st data-num="3313" class="">party</st> of the <st data-num="5330" class="">Pharisees</st> <st data-num="450">stood up</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1264">protested strongly</st>,<n id="4" /> “We <st data-num="2147" class="">find</st> <st data-num="3762" class="">nothing</st> <st data-num="2556" class="">wrong</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">with</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="444" class="">man</st>. What <st data-num="1487" class="">if</st> a <st data-num="4151" class="">spirit</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> an <st data-num="32" class="">angel</st> has <st data-num="2980" class="">spoken</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>?”

When the argument became so great the commanding officer feared that they would tear Paul to pieces, he ordered the detachment to go down, take him away from them by force, and bring him into the barracks.
The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said, “Have courage, for just as you have testified about me in Jerusalem, so you must also testify in Rome.”
When morning came, the Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink anything until they had killed Paul.

There <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">more</st> than <st data-num="5062" class="">forty</st> of them who <st data-num="4160" class="">formed</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="4945" class="">conspiracy</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="3748" class="">They</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="4334" class="">went</st><n id="2" /> to the <st data-num="749">chief priests</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4245" class="">elders</st> and <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>, “We have <st data-num="332" class="">bound</st> <st data-num="1438" class="">ourselves</st> <st data-num="332" class="">with</st> a <st data-num="331">solemn oath</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="3367" class="">not</st> to <st data-num="1089" class="">partake</st><n id="5" /> of anything <st data-num="2193" class="">until</st> we have <st data-num="615" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st>.

So now you and the council request the commanding officer to bring him down to you, as if you were going to determine his case by conducting a more thorough inquiry. We are ready to kill him before he comes near this place.”
But when the son of Paul’s sister heard about the ambush, he came and entered the barracks and told Paul.

<st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="4341" class="">called</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1520" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="1543" class="">centurions</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="5346" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="520" class="">Take</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="3494" class="">young man</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="5506" class="">commanding officer</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="1063" class="">for</st> he <st data-num="2192" class="">has</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">something</st> to <st data-num="518" class="">report</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>.”

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> the centurion<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3880" class="">took</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> and <st data-num="71" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="5506">commanding officer</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5346" class="">said</st>, “The <st data-num="1198" class="">prisoner</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="4341" class="">called</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st> and <st data-num="2065" class="">asked</st> me to <st data-num="71" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="3494">young man</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> because he <st data-num="2192" class="">has</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">something</st> to <st data-num="2980">tell</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>.”

The <st data-num="5506">commanding officer</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1949" class="">took</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> by the <st data-num="5495" class="">hand</st>, <st data-num="402" class="">withdrew</st> <st data-num="2398" class="">privately</st>, and <st data-num="4441" class="">asked</st>, “<st data-num="5101">What</st> is <st data-num="1510" class="">it</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">that</st> you <st data-num="2192" class="">want</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="518" class="">report</st> to <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>?”

He <st data-num="3004">replied</st>,<n id="1" /> “The <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> have <st data-num="4934" class="">agreed</st> to <st data-num="2065" class="">ask</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> to <st data-num="2609" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> <st data-num="2609" class="">down</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="4892" class="">council</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="839" class="">tomorrow</st>, <st data-num="5613" class="">as</st> if they were <st data-num="3195" class="">going</st> to <st data-num="4441" class="">inquire</st> <st data-num="196">more thoroughly</st> <st data-num="4012" class="">about</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>.

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> let <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="3982" class="">persuade</st> you to do this<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1063" class="">because</st> <st data-num="4183">more</st> than <st data-num="5062" class="">forty</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">of</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st><n id="2" /> are <st data-num="1748" class="">lying in ambush</st><n id="3" /> for <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>. They<n id="4" /> have <st data-num="332" class="">bound</st> <st data-num="1438" class="">themselves</st> <st data-num="332" class="">with an oath</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="3383" class="">not</st> to <st data-num="2068">eat</st> <st data-num="3383" class="">or</st> <st data-num="4095" class="">drink</st> anything<n id="6" /> <st data-num="2193" class="">until</st> they have <st data-num="337" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3568" class="">now</st> they <st data-num="1510" class="">are</st> <st data-num="2092" class="">ready</st>, <st data-num="4327" class="">waiting</st> <st data-num="575" class="">for</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> to agree to their <st data-num="1860">request</st>.”<n id="7" />

<st data-num="3767" class="">Then</st> the <st data-num="5506" class="">commanding officer</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="630" class="">sent</st> the <st data-num="3495">young man</st> <st data-num="630" class="">away</st>, <st data-num="3853" class="">directing</st> him,<n id="2" /> “<st data-num="1583">Tell</st> <st data-num="3367">no one</st> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> you have <st data-num="1718" class="">reported</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="3778" class="">these things</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>.”

<st data-num="2532" class="">Then</st><n id="1" /> he <st data-num="4341" class="">summoned</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1417" class="">two</st> of the <st data-num="1543" class="">centurions</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="3004">said</st>, “<st data-num="2090" class="">Make ready</st> <st data-num="1250" class="">200</st> <st data-num="4757" class="">soldiers</st> <st data-num="2193" class="">to</st> <st data-num="4198" class="">go</st> <st data-num="2193" class="">to</st> <st data-num="2542" class="">Caesarea</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">along</st> with <st data-num="1440" class="">70</st> <st data-num="2460" class="">horsemen</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1250">200</st> <st data-num="1187" class="">spearmen</st><n id="6" /> <st data-num="575" class="">by</st><n id="7" /> <st data-num="5154 5610">nine o’clock</st> <st data-num="3571" class="">tonight</st>,<n id="8" />

<st data-num="5037" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3936" class="">provide</st> <st data-num="2934" class="">mounts</st> for <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> to <st data-num="1913" class="">ride</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2443">so that</st> he may be <st data-num="1295" class="">brought safely</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="5344">Felix</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="2232" class="">governor</st>.”<n id="3" />
He wrote a letter that went like this:
Claudius Lysias to His Excellency Governor Felix, greetings.

<st data-num="3778" class="">This</st> <st data-num="435" class="">man</st> was <st data-num="4815" class="">seized</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="5259" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> they were <st data-num="3195" class="">about</st> to <st data-num="337" class="">kill</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>,<n id="2" /> when I <st data-num="2186">came up</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="4862" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="4753" class="">detachment</st><n id="4" /> and <st data-num="1807" class="">rescued</st> him because I had <st data-num="3129" class="">learned</st> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> he <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st><n id="5" /> a <st data-num="4514">Roman citizen</st>.<n id="6" />

Since I <st data-num="1014" class="">wanted</st> to <st data-num="1921" class="">know</st><n id="1" /> what <st data-num="156" class="">charge</st> they were <st data-num="1458" class="">accusing</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> of,<n id="2" /> I <st data-num="2609" class="">brought</st> him <st data-num="2609" class="">down</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="4892" class="">council</st>.<n id="3" />

I <st data-num="2147" class="">found</st> <st data-num="3739">he</st><n id="1" /> was <st data-num="1458" class="">accused</st> <st data-num="4012">with reference to</st> <st data-num="2213">controversial questions</st><n id="2" /> about <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="3551" class="">law</st>, <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="3367" class="">no</st> <st data-num="1462" class="">charge</st> against him <st data-num="514" class="">deserved</st> <st data-num="2288" class="">death</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="1199" class="">imprisonment</st>.<n id="3" />
When I was informed there would be a plot against this man, I sent him to you at once, also ordering his accusers to state their charges against him before you.
So the soldiers, in accordance with their orders, took Paul and brought him to Antipatris during the night.

The <st data-num="1887" class="">next day</st> they <st data-num="1439" class="">let</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="2460" class="">horsemen</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="565">go on</st> <st data-num="4862" class="">with</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, and they <st data-num="5290" class="">returned</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="3925" class="">barracks</st>.<n id="3" />

When <st data-num="3748">the horsemen</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1525" class="">came</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="2542" class="">Caesarea</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="325" class="">delivered</st> the <st data-num="1992" class="">letter</st> to the <st data-num="2232" class="">governor</st>, they <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="3936" class="">presented</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="3972" class="">Paul</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>.

When the governor<n id="1" /> had <st data-num="314" class="">read</st><n id="2" /> the letter,<n id="3" /> he <st data-num="1905" class="">asked</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="4169" class="">what</st> <st data-num="1885" class="">province</st> he <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> from.<n id="5" /> When he <st data-num="4441">learned</st><n id="6" /> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> he was <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="2791" class="">Cilicia</st>,<n id="7" />
he said, “I will give you a hearing when your accusers arrive too.” Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod’s palace.
